subtitle: chapter xlviii at Encinitas in
california a surprise sir during your
absence abroad we have had this
Encinitas hermitage built it is a
welcome home gift sister guy and not my
smiling let me through a gate and up a
tree shaded walk I saw a building
jutting out like a great white ocean
liner toward the blue brine first speech
Utley then with oohs and ahhs finally
with man's insufficient vocabulary of
joy and gratitude I examined the ashram
16 unusually large rooms each one
charmingly appointed the stately central
hall with immense ceiling high windows
looks out on a United altar of grass
ocean sky a sympathy and emerald opal
sapphire a mantle over the hills huge
fireplace holds the frame likeness of
Larry Masha smiling his blessing over
his far Pacific heaven directly below
the hall built into the very bluff two
solitary meditation caves confront the
infinities of sky and sea verandas
sunbathing nooks acres of orchard a
eucalyptus grove flagstone path leading
through roses and lilies - quiet arbors
a long flight of stairs ending on an
isolated beach and the vast waters was
dreamed ever more concrete may the good
and heroic and bountiful souls of the
saints come here reads a prayer for the
dwelling from the zen of Vesta fasted on
one of the hermitage doors and may they
go hand in hand with us giving the
healing virtues of their blessed gifts
as widespread as the earth as far-flung
as the rivers as far-reaching as a Sun
for the furtherance of better men for
the increase of abundance and glory may
obedience conquer disobedience within
this house may peace triumph fear /
discord free hearted giving / avarice
truthful speech / deceit reverence /
contempt that our minds be delighted and
our souls uplifted let our bodies be
glorified as well and old light divine
may we see thee and way me approaching
come round about thee and attain unto
the
entire companionship this
self-realization fellowship ashram had
been made possible through the
generosity of a few American disciples
American businessmen of endless
responsibilities who yet find time daily
for their Kriya yoga not a word of the
hermitage construction had been allowed
to reach me during my stay in Indian
Europe astonishment delight during my
early years in America I had combed the
coast of California in quest of a small
site for a seaside ashram whenever I
found a suitable location some obstacle
had invariably arisen to thwart me
gazing now over the broad anchors of
Enceladus I humbly saw the effortless
fulfillment of Sri Yukteswar s long ago
prophecy a hermitage by the ocean a few
months later Easter 1937 I conducted a
smooth lawns and Enceladus the first of
many sunrise services like the Magi of
old several hundred students gazed in
devotional ah at the daily miracle the
early solar fire right in the eastern
sky to the west lay the inexhaustible
Pacific booming its Solem praise in the
distance a tiny white sailing boat and
the lonely flight of a seagull Christ
thou art risen not along with the vernal
Sun but in the eternal dawn of spirit
many happy months sped by in the Peace
of perfect beauty I was able to complete
at a hermitage a long projected work
cosmic chance
I set the English words in western
musical notation about forty songs some
original others by adaptation of ancient
melodies including where the Shankara
chant no birth no death to fray verge of
Sri Yukteswar wake yet wake all my
spirit and desire my great enemy the
hoary Sanskrit him to Brahma old Bengali
songs
what lightning flash and I have heard
thy name Tagore's who is in my temple
and a number of my compositions I will
be thine always in the land beyond
dreams come out of the silent sky listen
to my soul call in the temple of silence
and thou art my life for a preface to
the sound book I recounted my first
outstanding experience with receptivity
of Westerners to the quaintly devotional
airs of the East the occasion had been a
public lecture the time April 18th 1926
the place Carnegie Hall in New York mr.
Hunsicker
I had confided to an American student I
am planning to ask the audience to sing
an ancient Hindi chant
Oh God beautiful sir mr. hunt segrete
protested these oriental songs are alien
to American understanding what a shame
of the lecture would be marred by a
commentary on overripe Tomatoes
I had laughingly disagreed music is a
universal language Americans will not
fail to feel the sole aspiration this
lofty chant during the lecture mr.
Hunsicker it sat behind me in the
platform probably fearing for my safety
his doubts were groundless not only had
there been an absence of unwelcome
vegetables but for 1 hour and 25 minutes
the strains of oh god beautiful had
sounded uninterruptedly from 3,000
throats
blazed no longer dear New Yorkers your
hearts had soared out into simple pion
of rejoicing divine healings had taken
place that evening among the devotees
chanting with love the Lord's blessed
name the secluded life of a literary
minstrel was not my role for long soon I
was dividing every fortnight between Los
Angeles and Ensenada
Sunday's services classes lectures
before clubs and colleges interviews
with students ceaseless stream of
correspondence articles for east-west
direction of activities in India
numerous small centers in American
cities much time was given also to the
arrangement of Korea and others
self-realization fellowship teaches into
a series of studies for the distant yoga
seekers who zeal recognize no limitation
of space
joyas dedication of the self-realization
church of all religions took place in
1938 in Washington DC said omits
landscaped grounds the stately church
stands in a section of the city
aptly called Friendship Heights the
Washington leaders Swami Ramananda
educated at the Ranchi School in
Calcutta University I had summoned him
in 1928 to assume leadership of a
Washington self-realization fellowship
center Prem Ananda I told him during a
visit to his new temple this Eastern
headquarters is the memorial and stone
to your tireless devotion here in the
nation's capital you have held aloft the
light of Larry Marcia's ideal Premanand
accompanied me from Washington for a
brief visit to the self-realization
fellowship Center in Boston what joy to
see again the Kriya yoga band who had
remained steadfast since 1920 the Boston
leader dr. M W Lewis lodged my companion
and myself in a modern artistically
decorated suite sir dr. Lewis said to me
smiling during your early years in
America you stayed in this city in a
single room without bath I wanted you to
know that Boston possesses some
luxurious apartments the shadows of
approaching carnage were lengthening
over the world already the acute year
might hear the frightful drums of war
during interviews with thousands in
California to the worldwide
correspondence I found that men and
women were deeply searching their hearts
the tragic Alderson security had
emphasised need for the eternal
anchorage we have indeed learned the
value of meditation the leader of the
london self-realization fellowship
center wrote me in 1941 and know that
nothing can disturb our inner peace in
the last few weeks during the meetings
we have heard air-raid warnings and
listened to the explosion delayed-action
bombs but our students still gather and
thoroughly enjoy our beautiful service
another letter reached me from war-torn
England just before America entered the
conflict in nobly pathetic words dr. L
Cronin being noted editor of the
system of the e-series wrote when I read
east-west I realize how far apart we
seem to be apparently living in two
different worlds beauty order calm and
peace come to me from Los Angeles
sailing into port is a vessel laden with
the blessing and comfort of the Holy
Grail to a beleaguered City I see is in
a dream your palm tree Grove and the
temple 1/10 sonatas with ocean stretches
and mountain views and above all its
fellowship of spirituality minded men
and women a communion comprehended in
unity absorbed in creative work and
replenished in contemplation
it is the world of my own vision in
making of which I hope to bear my little
part and now perhaps in the body
I shall never reach your golden shores
nor worship in your temple but there is
something and more to have had the
vision and know that in the midst of war
there is still a peace that abides in
your harbors and among your hills
greetings to all the fellowship from a
common soldier written on the watchtower
waiting for the dawn the warriors
brought a spiritual awakening among men
with who diversions had never before
included a study of the New Testament
one sweet distilment from the bitter
herbs of war to satisfy a growing need
an inspiring little self-realization
church of all religions was built and
dedicated in 1942 at Hollywood the sight
faces olive Hill and the distant Los
Angeles planetarium the church finished
in blue white and gold is reflected
amidst the water hyacinth in a large
pool the gardens are gay with flowers a
few startled stone deer a stained-glass
pergola and a quaint Wishing Well thrown
in with the pennies and kaleidoscope
wishes of man has been many a pure
aspiration for the soul treasures of
spirit a universal banana tea flows with
small niches with statues of Larry Masha
and Sri Yukteswar
and of Krishna Buddha Confucius Saint
Francis and the beautiful
mother-of-pearl reproduction of Christ
at the Last Supper
another self-realization Church of all
religion was founded in 1943 at San
Diego a quiet hilltop temple it stands
in a sloping valley of eucalyptus
overlooking sparkling San Diego Bay
sitting one evening in this tranquil
Haven I was poring over my heart and
song under my fingers was a sweet tone
organ of the church on my lips the
yearning plane of an ancient Bengali
devotee who had searched for eternal
solace in this world mother none can
love me in this world later not no love
divine where's their pure loving love
where is their truly loving me there my
heart longs to be my companion in the
chapel dr. Lloyd kennel the San Diego
Center leader was smiling a little at
the words of the song tell me truly para
mange has it been worth it he gazed at
me with an earnest sincerity I
understood his laconic question have you
been happy in America what about the
disillusionment the heart aches the
center leaders who could not lead the
students who could not be taught
blessed is the man who milord doth test
dr. he is remembered now and then to put
a burden on me I thought then of all the
faithful ones of the love and devotion
understanding that lay in the heart of
America with slow emphases I went on but
my answer is yes a thousand times yes it
has been worthwhile it has been a
constant inspiration more than I ever
dreamed to see east and west brought
closer and the only lasting bond the
spiritual silently I added a prayer may
Babaji and Sri Yukteswar J feel that I
have done my part not disappointing the
high hope in which they sent me forth I
turned again to the organ this time my
song with tinge with martial valor the
grinding wheel of time doth Mar full
many a life of moon and star and many a
brightly smiling morn but still my soul
is marching on
darkness death and failures vine to
block my path they fiercely tried my
fight with jealous nature strong but
still my soul is March 9 new year's week
of 1945 found me at work in Ansan itis
study revising it manuscript of this
book paramount CJ please come outdoors
dr. Lewis on a visit from Boston smiled
at me pleading me from outside my window
soon we were strolling in the sunshine
my companion pointed to new towers and
process of construction along the edge
of the fellowship properly adjoining the
coast highway sir I see many
improvements here since my last visit
dr. Lewis comes twice annually from
Boston to Ann Sunita Yes Doctor a
project I have long considered is
beginning to take tough in her form in
these beautiful surroundings I have
started a miniature world colony
brotherhood is an ideal better
understood by example and precept a
small harmonious group here may inspire
other ideal communities over the world a
splendid idea sir the colony will surely
be a success if everyone sincerely does
his part world is a large term but man
must enlarged allegiance considering
himself in the light of a world citizen
I continued a person who truly feels the
world is my homeland it is my America my
India my Philippines my England my
Africa will never lack scope for a
useful and happy life
his natural local pride will know
limitless expansion he will be in touch

dr. Lewis and I halted above the Lotus

for a world colony that is true doctor
we shall arrange here for many
conferences and congresses of religion

of the nations will hang in our halls
the meaning of temples will be built on
the grounds dedicated to the worlds
principle religions as soon as possible
I went on I plan to open a yoga

my dear friend the first Kriya yoga in

world colony's founded on a spiritual
basis the ills attributed to an

may be laid more realistically in the
door of every man
utopia must spring in the private bosom

man is a soul not an institution his
